settings.world_banner_content: Naturally Occurring. Farmed Sustainably. Scientifically backed.

settings.product_text:
Dubbed the ‘Miracle Tree’, Moringa has quite an introduction for being miraculous among those who benefit from its properties. Do you want to purify water? Bam - Moringa Seeds. Would you like some Tea? Bam - Moringa Flowers. You need a crazy boost in nutrition? Bam - Moringa Leaves. Enough said…  

Antioxidant Rich:  

Moringa is Antioxidant Rich and contains two strong Antioxidants called Quercetin, a powerful antioxidant which can assist in lowering blood pressure, & Chlorogenic acid which assists in moderating blood sugar levels. 

Anti – Inflammatory:  

Studies such as the Carrageenan-induced paw edema test have shown, that Moringa leaves possess anti-inflammatory properties, assisting in reducing inflammation in the body.  

Natural Antibiotic: Studies using the agar dilution method demonstrates that Moringa possesses natural antibiotic and antibacterial properties, which assists in inhibiting the growth of various pathogens.  

Complete Amino Acid:  

The problem? The human body cannot synthesize 9 of the 20 amino acids from other compounds in the body, therefore the body must look externally to obtain the 9 essential amino acids. Furthermore most plant foods are deficient in one or more essential amino acids, making this a difficult task (especially if you’re vegan). 

You’re Answer, Moringa! Being a complete plant protein means it contains all 9 essential amino acids. For other great protein sources see Chlorella as well. 

Rich in Nutrients: Jam packed with 27 vitamins and numerous minerals, gram for gram Moringa leaves contain: Twice the protein of yoghurt; four times the vitamin A of carrots; three times the potassium of bananas; four times the calcium of milk. 

Quite the Flex… 

Fights tiredness and Fatigue: An extension to the above Moringa is Rich in Iron and Vitamin A. Iron is essential for reducing fatigue and tiredness. Vitamin A supports the metabolism of iron ensuring a greater uptake. 

Digestive Aid: Moringa contains substantial amounts of Fibre, which can help support a healthy digestive system and bowel regularity. 

In conclusion the diet of people in developing nations often lacks vitamins, minerals and protein. In these countries, Moringa can be an important source of many essential nutrients.
settings.directions_text:
Smoothie: Add 1 tsp (5 grams) Moringa Powder to your Smoothie and/or Smoothie Bowl  

Face Mask: Mix 1 tsp (5 grams) Moringa Powder, 2 tsp Water, 1 tsp baking powder [optional 1 tsp honey] and let it sit for 10-15 minutes.
settings.faqs_text:
What is Moringa? 

The Moringa Tree or Moringa Oleifera to use its scientific name, is a medium-sized tree that is native to Africa and Asia. Every part of the Moringa tree has value: its seeds can be used to purify water; its bark, roots and flowers all have incredible medicinal properties and its leaves are one of the most nutrient-dense foods on the planet. 

Chirp Nation Moringa is made from the finest quality young Moringa leaves which are harvested, naturally dried and ground into a powder.  

How is Chirp Nation Moringa Powder made? 

Our Moringa is a natural powder made from dried Moringa leaves. Although the processing of Moringa leaves is simple, the quality is dependent on the delicate conditions needed for harvesting and drying - therefore, not all Moringa is made equal. 

To ensure nutrients are not damaged by the sunlight, our Moringa is harvested before dawn. The leaves are washed in purified water before drying. At this stage, the nutritional values of the leaf increases greatly - up to 10 X more than the fresh leaves!  

The dried leaves are then ground into a ready-to-use green powder, perfect for giving your food and drinks a nutritional boost.  

What does Chirp Nation Moringa Powder taste like? 

Our Moringa Powder has a leafy, spinachy flavour which is often compared to the taste of Matcha. Unlike other green superfoods like Spirulina and Chlorella, Moringa isn’t an algae so it doesn’t have a strong, overpowering flavour and is easy to incorporate into your daily diet. 

What are the health benefits of using Moringa? 

A single serving of Chirp Nation Moringa Powder is packed with a variety of vitamins and minerals. It is a rich source of complete proteins with all 9 essential amino acids (incredibly rare for a plant), iron, vitamin E and K and a source and vitamin A and calcium. Moringa also contains 24% fibre. It has one of the highest antioxidant contents of any food. We like to think of it as nature’s multivitamin! To find out some more details have a read through the benefits listed under the product description. 

How do I use Moringa powder? 

Our Moringa has a green spinach-like taste and is easy to incorporate into your daily diet. Try blending it into smoothies (along with other superfoods if you like), mixing it with apple juice or using it as a ‘superfood seasoning’ on your lunch or dinner. You can use it the same way as you would any veg, herb or seasoning. 

As Chirp Nation Moringa Powder is 100% pure leaf powder, there’s nothing you can’t mix it with - just let your imagination run free. 

What are the nutritional differences between Moringa powder and fresh Moringa leaves? 

When Moringa leaves are shade-dried like Chirp Nation Moringa, the nutritional content increases by over 10 X so generally speaking dried Moringa leaf powder has a far superior nutritional value than fresh leaves.  

The only nutrient that is reduced by the drying process is the vitamin C content which is higher in fresh leaves. Additionally, Moringa in its powdered form is much easier to incorporate into your diet especially if you are living in a climate where it doesn’t grow and it has a much longer shelf life than fresh Moringa leaves. 

Why have I read conflicting information about the amount of vitamin C in Moringa? 

It is often reported that Moringa powder is rich in vitamin C however, this is inaccurate. While it is true that fresh Moringa leaves are high in vitamin C (containing 200mg per 100g), when Moringa leaves are dried to form a powder, the vitamin C levels diminish considerably. Dried Moringa powder has on average around 2mg of vitamin C per 100g, which is not enough to be classified as a source (it would need 12mg per 100g).  

Is it safe to consume during pregnancy? 

Generally speaking If you are pregnant or trying to conceive, we recommend seeking medical advice before taking Moringa or any of our other products. 

That being said, you may be interested to know that if you are breastfeeding, Moringa has been scientifically proven to increase breast milk! This is because the leaves are a natural galactagogue, a substance that promotes or increases the flow of a mother’s milk. #Food4Thought

settings.testimonial_text: A Delicious Daily Boost and love that the packaging is Recyclable!
Awesome concept and great tasting products

settings.superfood_why_us_content:
Have you ever wondered how a nutritional label gets created, or how much if any credibility underpins a company’s product claim? Better yet, do you even know what credible means when it comes to nutritional claims?

 

Three simple questions, yet the scientific method that underpins them is complicated in constant change. Here's the thing. The industry finds itself operating in a ‘shade of grey’ spectrum. The problem with a spectrum is that it causes complexity. - Complexity from which companies can benefit by making incorrect claims or making ignorant mistakes. - Complexity for regulators as shades of grey become challenging boundaries to regulate. Picture umpiring a tennis match where the lines are constantly moving. 'Ouch'.

- Complexity from which companies can benefit by making incorrect claims or making ignorant mistakes.

- Complexity for regulators as shades of grey become challenging boundaries to regulate. Picture umpiring a tennis match where the out of bounds are constantly moving 'ouch'.

 

Therefore, we at Chirp Nation have a mistrust for the food industry and want to emphasise, that it’s not always your job to be aware, consider and examine all things nutrition when buying foods. You’re supposed to be able to depend and trust the people you buy from. That’s our point – Chirp Nation is not going to promise you the world without ensuring we can deliver it. And we do!
settings.superfood_tab_content_1:
Lions Mane has been reported to promote nerve growth factor production. Nerve growth factor is involved in maintaining and organizing cholinergic neurons in the central nervous system, meaning it may be appropriate for the prevention or treatment of dementia.

In this experiment mice with induced learning and memory deficits were given Lions Mane over a 23-day period. The mice’s memory and learning function was examined using the Y-maze and the novel-object recognition test.

 

The results revealed that Lions Mane prevented impairments of spatial short-term and visual recognition memory in the learning and memory deficits induced mice. This finding indicates it may be useful in the prevention of cognitive dysfunction.
settings.superfood_tab_content_2:
The fruiting body of Lions Mane has been demonstrated to possess anti-dementia activity in a mouse model of Alzheimer's disease and people with mild cognitive impairment. After a 30-day oral administration to 5 month-old female transgenic mice, they found the following:

- Lions Mane and its ethanol extract improved the cerebral plaque burden (for the non-compact structure)

- The level of the insulin-degrading enzyme was elevated by in the cerebral cortex

- The number of plaque-activated microglia and astrocytes in cerebral cortex and hippocampus were diminished

- The ratio of nerve growth factor (NGF) to NGF precursor (proNGF) increased and hippocampal neurogenesis was promoted 


The result was thus all the mentioned benefits of these administrations may therefore improve the declined activity of daily living skill in transgenic mice, demonstrating therapeutic potential for Alzheimer’s disease.
settings.superfood_tab_content_3:
Fifteen men received 30 placebos and 30 chlorella tablets per day for 4 weeks separated by a 12-week washout period. Before and after each trial, saliva samples were carefully collected. The result was:

- Placebo - No difference was observed in salivary before and after placebo ingestion Chlorella

- Significantly increased in the local production of detectable antibodies (Immunoglobulin A)

 

Chlorella for the impressive win.
settings.superfood_tab_content_4:
Antioxidants are compounds that act against free radicals in your body. Elevated levels of free radicals may cause oxidative stress, associated with chronic diseases like heart disease and type 2 diabetes.

 

Upon investigating the antioxidant, hypolipidaemic (hypolipidaemic agents, cholesterol-lowering) and antiatherosclerotic (the agent that combats the disease by which plaque builds up inside your arteries stopping the necessary oxygen getting to your heart) activities of Moringa Oleifera leaf extract the results indicated that Moringa possesses a significant degree of antioxidants, hypolipidaemic and antiatherosclerotic activities and demonstrates therapeutic potential for the prevention of cardiovascular diseases.
settings.superfood_tab_content_5:
Matcha consumption has been shown to promote fat oxidation in humans at rest and to prevent obesity and improve insulin sensitivity in mice. An investigation of the effects of Matcha ingestion on glucose tolerance and fat oxidation during moderate-intensity exercise in humans was done.

- Study A - 12 healthy men performed a 30-min cycling exercise at 60% of maximal oxygen consumption before and after supplementation.

- Study B - 11 healthy men took an oral-glucose-tolerance test before and after supplementation.

 

The results:

- Average fat oxidation rates were 17% higher after ingestion of Matcha compared to the placebo.

- The contribution of fat oxidation to total energy expenditure was also significantly higher, by a similar percentage.

 

Matcha ingestion can increase fat oxidation during moderate-intensity exercise and can improve insulin sensitivity and glucose tolerance in healthy young men
settings.superfood_tab_content_6:
Antioxidants are important because they neutralize the adverse effects of free radicals throughout the body.

 

If free radicals are unneutralized by antioxidants, they can damage cells and lead to a number of diseases, including diabetes, cancer and heart disease. Acai berries have a incredibly high number of antioxidants, edging out other antioxidant-rich fruits like blueberries and cranberries.

 

The antioxidant content of nutritious foods is typically measured by an Oxygen Radical Absorbance Capacity (ORAC) score. In the rare case of acai, 100 grams of frozen pulp invariably has an ORAC of 102,700, whereas the same number of blueberries scored 4,669. Blueberries are ordinarily moderately high on the local ORAC food chain to begin with demonstrating that ACAI is not to be fu***** with.
settings.superfood_tab_content_7:
In the study, the preventive effects of Matcha on the progression of hepatic (liver) and renal (kidney) damage in type 2 diabetic rats was investigated. The rats were administered Matcha for 16 weeks and the biochemical parameters in the serum, liver, and kidney amongst other things were assessed.

 

The results found Matcha treatment significantly lowered the glucose, triglyceride, and total cholesterol levels in the serum, liver and renal areas.

 

These results suggest Matcha guards against hepatic and renal damage through the suppression of renal advanced glycation end products (AGE's) accumulation. This was achieved by decreasing the hepatic glucose, triglyceride, and total cholesterol levels, and by its antioxidant activities.
settings.which_superfood_textarea_1:
Chlorella is a single-celled, green freshwater Algae. As it traditionally stands, there are over 30 different species of Chlorella found all around the world, but two distinct types — Chlorella Vulgaris and Chlorella Pyrenoidosa — are most commonly used in research.

 

Because chlorella naturally has a hard cell wall that humans cannot digest, you must take it as a supplement to reap its benefits and that my good folk is where we come in.
settings.which_superfood_textarea_2:
Wheatgrass comes from the family Triticum Aestivum. People harvest it early in its development before it attains full size. This is ordinarily 7–10 days after sprouting.

 

Some people call wheatgrass green blood because it contains elevated levels of chlorophyll, which gives wheatgrass products an unusual greenish hue. Wheatgrass contains few calories but is rich in essential vitamins, valuable minerals, key proteins, and active enzymes.
settings.which_superfood_textarea_3:
Acai berries are a Brazilian "Superfruit." They're native to the Amazon region where they're a staple food. However, they've recently gained popularity globally and are universally praised for being enormously beneficial to health and well-being.

 

This deep purple fruit certainly packs tonnes of nutrition goodness and it may indeed enjoy some health benefits too.
settings.which_superfood_textarea_4:
Hericium Erinaceus (aka lion's mane mushroom) is an edible and medicinal mushroom belonging to the tooth fungus group. Native to North America, Europe and Asia it can be identified by its long spines (greater than 1 cm length).

 

This delicious mushroom has been referred to as ‘Nature’s Nutrient for the Neurons’ on account of its ability to stimulate the production of nerve growth factors (NGF), key compounds in promoting nerve repair and regeneration in the brain.
settings.which_superfood_textarea_5:
Matcha has skyrocketed in popularity with Matcha shots, lattes, teas and even desserts appearing everywhere from health stores to coffee shops. Like green tea, Matcha comes from the Camellia Sinensis plant. However, it is grown differently and enjoys a unique nutrient profile.


 

Matcha contains the nutrients from the entire tea leaf, which results in a vaster amount of caffeine and antioxidants than are typically found in green tea. Studies of Matcha and its components have unearthed a variety of benefits, showing it can help protect the liver, promote heart health and even aid in weight loss.
settings.which_superfood_textarea_6:
Native to Africa and Asia, the Moringa Tree or Moringa Oleifera to use its scientific name, is one of the most nutrient-rich plants in the world.  Aduna Moringa Powder is made from naturally dried moringa leaves. It has a delicious spinachy green flavour, perfect for boosting curries, stews, casseroles, soups, salads, green smoothies and more.

 

As Moringa Powder is a natural source of these nutrients, it is highly bioavailable, so our bodies can absorb the benefits more easily than by taking synthetic supplements. Studies of Matcha and its components have unearthed a variety of benefits, showing it can help protect the liver, promote heart health and even aid in weight loss.

settings.superfood_why_us_content:
You may have heard the UN report as being the reason most other companies have started an insect-based company, so we won’t bore you with stale news. The thing is, though, it doesn’t help to sell an alternative protein if no one can comfortably afford it. That’s why we are on a collective mission to reduce the demand of livestock worldwide, and making insects unaffordable doesn’t get us there.

 

We are on an EAT FOR CHANGE movement and would genuinely love it if soldiered with us.
settings.superfood_tab_content_1: Complete Profile of the 9 essential amino acids the body can not produce on its own and thus needs to properly obtain from preferred food sources.
settings.superfood_tab_content_2: Carefully packed with 64g protein, Crickets contain more Protein than the old regular Protein Rich Foods like chicken, pork and beef
settings.superfood_tab_content_3: Crickets regularly outperform high in fibre food sources. Fibre is important for digestive health and regular bowel movements.
settings.superfood_tab_content_4: An extensive source of calcium from a non-dairy source. Calcium is one of the most critical minerals for the human body. It helps form and properly maintain healthy teeth and bones.
settings.superfood_tab_content_5: Crickets are carefully packed with Iron. Iron contributes positively to the meaningful reduction of tiredness and fatigue.
settings.superfood_tab_content_6: Vitamin B12 is essential for the normal functioning of the active brain and nervous system.
settings.superfood_tab_content_7: You can traditionally cook with them, bake with them, Snack on them and invariably create delicious High Protein Smoothies. Your imagination represents the limit.
settings.which_superfood_textarea_1: Crickets are carefully packed with Vitamins, Minerals and of course Protein. In remarkable fact, per 1kg of Protein, Crickets outperform regular protein sources significantly.
settings.which_superfood_textarea_2: Crickets significantly require fewer Resources to farm. Crickets are not finicky eaters and require significantly less Feed than regular protein sources.
settings.which_superfood_textarea_3: Cricket farms can grow vertically, naturally occupying even less space of our precious planet & powerfully aiding us in combating deforestation.
settings.which_superfood_textarea_4:
Did you know the livestock industry was responsible for more greenhouse gases than the whole transportation sector combined?
Crickets significantly emit fewer greenhouse gases and can therefore aid us to combat Climate Change.

settings.about_textarea:
Antioxi was founded as a response of feeling frustrated with the lack of transparency in the Food industry as well as the
complexity and affordability behind many products. We wanted to create a safe place where people could find the products
they needed, all the information around them, portray this in a simple way for everyone to understand and ensure that they
are budget friendly.

settings.blog_textarea: Find out more about the food revolution and what it means to Eat For Change.

settings.heading: BUT DON’T TAKE OUR WORD FOR IT...SEE IT FOR YOURSELF

settings.our_founders_founder_1_description: Staying focused can sometimes feel impossible, especially when you are juggling 10 things at once! This is why I love Lion's mane! It helps me stay focused and alert every single day.
settings.our_founders_founder_2_description: Living with IBS I have struggled daily with bloating and a whole lot of discomfort. We developed the alkaline blend to not only sooth the symptoms when they creep up... but also to prevent them from happening entirely.

settings.offer_text1: Medicinal mushrooms protect your body from the harmful effects of stress, support overall health, energy and mood. In most simplest terms, they help your body 'adapt' to your emotional and physical needs.
settings.offer_text2: Nutrient-rich foods from around the world, that are especially beneficial for your health and well being. They offer a variety of benefits such as being a source of important nutrients, detoxing your body and managing energy levels.

settings.small_heading: THE HEALTHIER VERSION OF YOU AWAITS

settings.heading: HEAR WHAT OUR COMMUNITY HAS TO SAY ABOUT US

settings.content:
• All products are organically farmed. In a controlled environment. No pesticides involved.
  • Farming is more eco-friendly than foraging. Unfortunately, foraging can lead to extinction (as with Lion’s Mane in Europe).

• All products are 100% natural. No additives, fillers or chemicals. Nothing that makes your stomach funky every single time you take it.
  • We use careful extraction & production processes. So you can gain as many medicinal & nutritional benefits as possible.

• We’re open about our mushrooms and various superfoods being sourced from China. In fact, in China mushroom usage has a rich history.  Going on a 1000 years!
  • You see - in Europe, it wouldn’t be doable (re: climate, economics, resources) to grow *genuine* mushrooms for supplements
  • And remember: all products have been tested for heavy metals.  No toxins here. If you ask, we’re happy to send the lab reports.

• Our website is simple for you to use. And not full of confusing mushroom jargon.
  • We love engaging with the AntiOxi community. Heck, we’ve even personally delivered products before. One customer had an adorable dog (with cancer) that we got to meet.

settings.heading: THE HIGHS & LOWS... & HIGHS AGAIN!
settings.content:
After learning about the terrible state of agricultural farming -- we wanted to make a change.

So we sold sustainable proteins... Turns out… the market wasn’t ready for that.

And yet, our organic superfood products were successful. A big win for sustainable farming!

But then… a family member was diagnosed with cancer.
It was a lonely experience. The doctors offered limited options.

So we researched into medicinal mushrooms. But finding *honest* info was difficult. Plus, there was too much confusing jargon.

Why couldn’t it be simple to get what one needed?

We realised that in Europe – the demand is high… but the (genuine) supply is low.

So eventually, our little business integrated medicinal mushroom products. Legitimate & organic ones.

Which brings us to today...

Being able to supply eco-friendly mushrooms & superfoods, throughout Europe. To a lovely community. Who keep coming back. :-)
